alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; Phillips; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lee, eastern St. Francis, northeastern Phillips, Crittenden, DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, Tunica, Tate, northwestern Benton, northwestern Panola, southwestern Fayette and Shelby Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meeman Shelby Forest State Park to Anthonyville to Haynes. Movement was southeast at 90 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Forrest City, Hernando, Marion, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Hughes, Madison, Cordova, St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis and Coldwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
